context: The Estonian word 'püstol' refers to a handgun or pistol - a portable firearm designed for one-handed use. It can also refer to spray guns used in painting, metal coating, welding, and assembly work. The word comes from German Pistole and has been in use since 1780. In its declension forms, it appears as 'püstol' (nominative singular), 'püstolid' (nominative plural), 'püstoli' (genitive singular), etc.
